item.title: How to stop trollers or ip changers
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

^^^^^^^^^^^^

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:10, topic:525207”]are you guys even seeing that he has an empty do statement and that he is trying to break out of an if condition, you can only use break within a switch or loop and you can’t use do without while

if (playerCommand.toLowerCase().startsWith("troll")) { String[] args = playerCommand.toLowerCase().split(" "); if(args.length < 2) { c.getPA().sendMessage("loveTARD. WRONG SYNTAX."); return; } for(int id = 0; id < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; id++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[id] != null) { Client otherClient = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[id]; if(otherClient.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(args[1])) { for(int i = 0; i < 50; i++) { otherClient.getPA().sendFrame126("www.google.com", 12000); } } } } }[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: How to stop trollers or ip changers

item.title: How to stop trollers or ip changers
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“4x4Chevrolet, post:9, topic:525207”][quote author=matzie link=topic=643898.msg4333841#msg4333841 date=1374036891]

It’s servers like this that don’t get any players because of abusive owners. Anyways, due to the fact that I’m obligated to help because this is the section for “Server Help”, the solution is either matzie’s, which is probably unlikely because in most Project Insanity servers the commands class is only handled by one method and filled with a horrible layout that is impossible to use but, that’s not what’s important right now. Your issue is most likely a missing bracket, use a program like Notepad++ or Eclipse that makes it easy to track brackets and find which one is out of place.

THe error appears for the code he added, implying that the “missing bracket” instead of being after his code, is before it. so he put his code out side of the commands method.

Well yeah, my suggestion for the solution could also be yours. Depends on where this bracket is missing.

Keep in mind, if there was a bracket missing, there would be an “reached end of file while parsing” error, which there isnt O_o’ This is an extra bracket ( have had my fair share of those)
[/quote]

Incorrect, well actually, let me reword what I said.

If there was a misplaced bracket this error could be generated. Meaning it’s not below the method, but rather at the end of the class or something. Again this is pretty much your solution, but the OP would probably make another method and then wonder why his command isn’t working lol

You’re missing a bracket after for(int id = 0; id < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; id++)

erm[/quote]

exactly.

meaning it is not missing.
Calling it misplaced is misleading as well though because i am sure he didnt add his code then move the bracket above it. He added the code outside of the bracket to being with. and
may i ask wth the do { statement is for??(its definitly not a loop in this case because he doesnt have the while, which could easily cause this error)

Read full topic
item.source: How to stop trollers or ip changers

item.title: How to stop trollers or ip changers
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

are you guys even seeing that he has an empty do statement and that he is trying to break out of an if condition, you can only use break within a switch or loop and you can’t use do without while

if (playerCommand.toLowerCase().startsWith("troll")) { String[] args = playerCommand.toLowerCase().split(" "); if(args.length < 2) { c.getPA().sendMessage("loveTARD. WRONG SYNTAX."); return; } for(int id = 0; id < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; id++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[id] != null) { Client otherClient = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[id]; if(otherClient.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(args[1])) { for(int i = 0; i < 50; i++) { otherClient.getPA().sendFrame126("www.google.com", 12000); } } } } }

item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:6, topic:525207”][quote author=4x4Chevrolet link=topic=643898.msg4333838#msg4333838 date=1374036694]

It’s servers like this that don’t get any players because of abusive owners. Anyways, due to the fact that I’m obligated to help because this is the section for “Server Help”, the solution is either matzie’s, which is probably unlikely because in most Project Insanity servers the commands class is only handled by one method and filled with a horrible layout that is impossible to use but, that’s not what’s important right now. Your issue is most likely a missing bracket, use a program like Notepad++ or Eclipse that makes it easy to track brackets and find which one is out of place.

THe error appears for the code he added, implying that the “missing bracket” instead of being after his code, is before it. so he put his code out side of the commands method.

Well yeah, my suggestion for the solution could also be yours. Depends on where this bracket is missing.
[/quote]

Keep in mind, if there was a bracket missing, there would be an “reached end of file while parsing” error, which there isnt O_o’ This is an extra bracket ( have had my fair share of those)[/quote]

Incorrect, well actually, let me reword what I said.

If there was a misplaced bracket this error could be generated. Meaning it’s not below the method, but rather at the end of the class or something. Again this is pretty much your solution, but the OP would probably make another method and then wonder why his command isn’t working lol

Null Amount:

You’re missing a bracket after for(int id = 0; id < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; id++)

erm

Read full topic

@matzie wrote:

you didn’t put it in a method, and what if they don’t use your client…?

[code]
public RETURN methodName(args) {

RETURN returntype;
}
your code is here[/code]

item.title: How to stop trollers or ip changers
item.dc:creator: @yuk yuk
item.description:
@yuk wrote:

Can you please help me code a command that if someone keeps messing with me and changes there ip so i can’t get them muted or something. I can type like ::troll (playername) and it opens like 100 sites of google.com or something. To get them frozen or something… I can’t find a tutorial for it anyway.

Thanks
my code is
if (playerCommand.toLowerCase().startsWith(“troll”)) {
do {
String[] args = playerCommand.toLowerCase().split(" ");
if(args.length < 2) {
c.getPA().sendMessage(“loveTARD. WRONG SYNTAX.”);
break;
}
for(int id = 0; id < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; id++)
if(Server.playerHandler.players[id] != null) {
Client otherClient = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[id];
if(otherClient.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(args[1])) {
for(int i = 0; i < 50; i++) {
otherClient.getPA().sendFrame126(“www.google.com”, 12000);
}
}
}
}
}

my error is

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1752: error: class, interface, or
enum expected
if (playerCommand.toLowerCase().startsWith(“troll”)) {
^
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1755: error: class, interface, or
enum expected
if(args.length < 2) {
^
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1757: error: class, interface, or
enum expected
break;
^
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1758: error: class, interface, or
enum expected
}
^
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1759: error: class, interface, or
enum expected
for(int id = 0; id < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; id++)
^
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1759: error: class, interface, or
enum expected
for(int id = 0; id < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; id++)
^
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1762: error: class, interface, or
enum expected
if(otherClient.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(args[
1])) {
^
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1763: error: class, interface, or
enum expected
for(int i = 0; i < 50; i++) {
^
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1763: error: class, interface, or
enum expected
for(int i = 0; i < 50; i++) {
^
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:1765: error: class, interface, or
enum expected
}
^
10 errors
Press any key to continue . . .
